headline: KEYTRUDA® (pembrolizumab) Plus Trodelvy® (sacituzumab govitecan-hziy) Reduced Risk of Disease Progression or Death by 35% Versus KEYTRUDA Plus Chemotherapy in First-Line PD-L1+ Metastatic Triple-Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC)
summary: RAHWAY, N.J., May 31, 2025--Merck (NYSE: MRK), known as MSD outside of the United States and Canada, today announced that KEYTRUDA® (pembrolizumab) plus Trodelvy® (sacituzumab govitecan-hziy) reduced the risk of disease progression or death by 35% (HR=0.65, p<0.001) versus KEYTRUDA plus chemotherapy for the first-line treatment of patients with PD-L1+ (Combined Positive Score [CPS] ≥10) inoperable (unresectable) locally advanced or metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), as determined b
